siteProductLine.name: VikingContact 7
siteProductLine.overview:
The VikingContact 7 is a winter tire that offers drivers powerful traction and braking on snow and ice covered roads.

Features & Benefits
  • Winter tread design
  • Black sidewall
  • Three Peak Mountain Snowflake symbol means this tire has been certified to perform in severe snow conditions
  • Backed by Continental's Total Confidence Plan which includes Road Hazard, Limited Warranty, Customer Satisfaction Trial, Flat Tire Roadside Assistance, and Mileage Warranty (restrictions and limitations apply)
siteProductLine.secondaryDescription: Falling temperatures often come with snow, ice, and other winter weather elements. Drivers who have to combat these elements while temperatures are commonly below 45 degrees Fahrenheit might need to consider purchasing a set of winter tires. Consider the VikingContact 7 from Continental,  which is designed with a Nordic tread compound for superb grip on wet roads and flexibility in cold weather. Grooves within the tread remove water, slush, and snow from the road to reduce the risk of hydroplaning, and the VikingContact 7's interlocking blocks provide extra stability on snow covered roads. Built with added biting edged to equip drivers with powerful traction and braking, the VikingContact 7 features a Three Peak Mountain Snowflake symbols thanks to its ability to perform in severe snow conditions.

siteProductSpecs.name: Category
siteProductSpecs.description: Winter tires are built with a flexible rubber compound that allows for consistent grip on roads when the temperature is below 40 degrees. Able to conquer ice, snow, and slush, winter tires are either come in a standard design or they can be pinned with studs to improve grip.

siteProductSpecs.name: Vehicle
siteProductSpecs.description: Passenger tires are some of the most common tires you'll find on the roads today, and frequently used on coupes, sedans, hatchbacks, minivans, and other passenger vehicles. Passenger tires are available in a wide variety of types, such as all-season, winter, and ultra-high-performance.

siteProductSpecs.name: Mileage Warranty
siteProductSpecs.description: This product is not covered by a manufacturer’s treadlife warranty.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Index
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum carrying capacity for a tire determined by the manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Max Speed
siteProductSpecs.description: Maximum speed capability to safely carry a load for an extended period of time.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum load carrying strength at the specified inflation pressure, also known as ply rating.

siteProductSpecs.name: Sidewall
siteProductSpecs.description: The side of the tire between the tread and rim, with cosmetic branding as well as information about the tire including manufacturer, model, size, etc.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Depth
siteProductSpecs.description: Measured in 32nds of an inch, this metric shows how much tread life is left on a tire, with the tire's traction & stopping capabilities greatly diminished at 4/32nds and less. Tire manufacturers include "tire wear bars" at 2/32nds to indicate when your tire is worn out.

siteProductSpecs.name: Inflation Pressure
siteProductSpecs.description: The highest inflation pressure (measured in pounds of force per square inch, PSI) the tire is designed to contain, and should only be used when called for by the vehicle placard.

siteProductSpecs.name: Part Number
siteProductSpecs.description: An identifier of a particular tire line and size combination assigned by the tire manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Design
siteProductSpecs.description: Tread design (or tread pattern) can affect handling, traction & noise for different driving styles & road conditions.

siteProductSpecs.name: Section Width
siteProductSpecs.description: The measurement of width from a tires inner sidewall to the outer sidewall.

siteProductSpecs.name: Rim Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The range of widths the rim of the vehicle can be for this tire to be safely mounted on.

siteProductSpecs.name: Overall Diameter
siteProductSpecs.description: The diameter of a tire that is inflated without any load applied.

siteProductSpecs.name: Three-Peak Mountain Snowflake (3PMS)
siteProductSpecs.description: A three-peak mountain snowflake (3PMSF) symbol branded on a tire's sidewall indicates the tire meets required performance criteria in snow testing to be considered severe snow service-rated.

image.altText: Winter Tire Driving in Snowy Winter Conditions

header.title: Winter tires
header.body:
# Winter Tires
Winter tires, also known as snow tires, are ideal for use in below [freezing temperatures](https://simpletire.com/learn/tire-maintenance-safety/when-to-switch-to-snow-tires) thanks to their flexible rubber compound that allows them to consistently grip the road. 

Commonly used on all types of vehicles, snow and winter tires often come in non-studded, [studded](https://simpletire.com/learn/tire-buying-guides/studded-tires), and studdable designs, with the latter two allowing drivers to enhance traction and performance in ice, slush, and snow. Winter tires often feature a Three Peak Mountain Snowflake (3PMS) symbol on their sidewall to denote that they're certified to perform in severe snow conditions. 

Several tire manufacturers make snow and winter tires including [Bridgestone](https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/categories/winter), [Michelin](https://simpletire.com/brands/michelin-tires/categories/winter), [Hankook](https://simpletire.com/brands/hankook-tires/categories/winter), [Continental](https://simpletire.com/brands/continental-tires/categories/winter) and Nokian to name a few. 

If you're looking to buy a set of winter tires online then you've come to the right spot, as SimpleTire has thousands of winter tires that meet the budget and needs of drivers.

[Winter tire reviews](https://simpletire.com/categories/winter-tires/reviews)
